conclusion: To find the acceleration of the particle during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds, we need to determine the slope of the velocity-time (v-t) graph during that interval. Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, which is represented by the slope of the v-t graph.
At t = 1 second, the velocity v1 = 2 m/s.
At t = 3 seconds, the velocity v2 = -2 m/s.
Calculate the change in velocity (Δv): Δv = v2 - v1 = -2 m/s - 2 m/s = -4 m/s
Calculate the change in time (Δt): Δt = t2 - t1 = 3 s - 1 s = 2 s
Determine the acceleration (a) using the formula: a = Δv / Δt = -4 m/s / 2 s = -2 m/s^2
